name: Hamzah Khan
experience: Team Alpha helped me understand that with a few baseline values, everything you want and more in life falls into place.

name: Andy Hampton
experience: Team Alpha exposed me to some truly awesome people who put their necks on the line every day to make their dreams happen. It taught me the value of mastering your craft and the necessity of persistence. I learned some life lessons in my time with team alpha.

name: Lawrence Rogers
experience: Made me feel empowered to say "why not" instead of "why?". It helped me realize that if I don't know something I can go and find out and learn, instead of being content. Gave me a good perspective going into college: "I can learn a lot in school, and I can also learn a lot out in the world--I should do both!"

name: Jamie Pridemore
experience:
I gained a lot of skills and now I'm getting dollar dollar bills... y'all.
Or just say "I gained a vast amount of technical and business expertise in a short amount of time, grew as a person, and learned to leverage my strong points into becoming a better all around human being."

name: Dave Boyer
experience: They gave me my first opportunity, where I could prove to myself that I could be successful in the field after starting out late in life at it and start to get some real experience on the resume. Sure enough I've gone on to do awesome things for some of the biggest names in Android and help a lot of people.

name: Tyler Green
experience: Team Alpha taught me that anything can be awesome if you choose to make it that way. All it takes is the right effort and mindset!

name: Meredith Scroggin
experience: I really didn't know what I wanted coming into Awesome Inc, but I really think they helped me in many things that I didn't realize. I gained a lot of insight into potential careers and how to be a part of a community that drives you to want to do better as an individual and in a group.

name: Adam Shepherd
experience: Awesome Inc. helped me reach my definition of Awesome by encouraging me to solve difficult tasks on my own. Instead of giving me the answers to my problems, I was encouraged to solve the problem independently. I have taken this mentality and have incorporated it into my own career. There is no one to ask help from when you are the first to try something new in your industry. You have to learn from your mistakes and press forward ever harder. This mentality that fosters independence is truly Awesome.

name: Stefan Hagfors
experience: Gave me motivation to find something I love doing and making what I love doing even more awesome.

name: Jessika Jones
experience: Team Alpha challenged me to push myself for excellence, not only in my professional life but in my personal life as well. I better understand how important it is to invest in relationships and how essential time management and prioritization are in executing one's plan for success!

name: Carter Fifield
experience: Team Alpha gave me the opportunity to reach my awesome. If I needed help with anything or had questions about anything they were there to help me. They provided me with the tools I needed to reach my awesome.

name: Sarah Detraz
experience: Their use of FIO (figure it out ) really helped me the take lead, but they also acted as a support for when I needed to figure something out and reach a goal.

name: Austin Magsig
experience: Team Alpha helped me by opening me up to the world of entrepreneurship and coding, which I am continuing to learn about in college.

name: Gus Logsdon
experience: I learned a lot about web sites be how to have fun at work

name: Stacy Haynes
experience: Team Alpha gave me the opportunity to work on awesome projects, meet great people, and develop my video editing skills.

name: Jessica Powers
experience: It introduced me to more people around Lexington (who have since gone on/come back/ or stayed) than I had known before and helped build my confidence to do more things, get out and explore and have the initiative to ask when you want to learn.

name: Calah Ford
experience: Team Alpha is a great place to explore and find what suites you. The expectations are high, but so is the support. If you want to get to experience a large variety of projects in one central place, Awesome Inc is the place to do it. Not to mention how much fun it is! :)

name: Ben Childress
experience: I think at the end of the day Team Alpha was so awesome because of all the people involved with it. The passion and energy that surrounds Awesome Inc and Team Alpha is something that has been unmatched by any other community that I have ever been apart of. It inspires you to do better and be better. The environment is contagious, and I know that for me it helped me realize my own potential and grow in my self confidence in my own ability.

name: Cody James
experience: It gave me pieces to add to my portfolio, and the confidence to move forward with my goals.

name: Rebecca Fields
experience: The encouragement and support its given me over the years... And reminder that failure is part of the journey to success.

name: Huu Nguyen
experience: Gave me the skills, experience, and guidance needed to become a confident web developer.

name: Shoba Dickinson
experience: I was thrown into a lot of new projects and given support when I needed it. That helped me be more confident and good self esteem is part of my definition of awesome.

name: Steve Osowicz
experience: After selling a successful but very stressful business, Team Alpha and other Awesome Incers helped me to realize I can have a small business that is fun and profitable, but that doesn't consume my life.

name: Ashley Edwards
experience: Helped me determine the types of marketing with which I preferred to work.

name: Rusty Leskiv
experience: Exposed to technology entrepreneurship world

name: Henry Yan
experience: Startup Weekend

name: Adam Dahl
experience: Team Alpha was a great experience for lots of reasons. In addition to helping me reach my definition of awesome by being a great support system for our weird ideas, it really helps you have the confidence to be yourself and go after the things that make you happy. At the end of the day, that's really what it's all about (contrary to what some people may say about the hokey pokey).

name: Stephanie Dawson
experience: Customer relationship is invaluable no matter the setting, and being given the opportunity to deal with local artists prepared me to work with future clients in other settings. Had I been faced with dealing with bank VP's before gaining experience at awesome Inc, I wouldn't have been as successful.

name: Aaron Fons
experience: Team Alpha helped me to reach my definition of awesome simply by enabling me to take my best shot at doing whatever I wanted to do as a grassroots entrepreneur. Beyond that, the people on Team Alpha provided nonstop support and friendship that I will cherish forever, and I haven't seen anything like it in any organization since.

name: Ethan Smith
experience: It gave me a lot of real world experience working with development projects that are practical as opposed to academic in nature. When I was high school it was hard to find any academic exposure to computer programming and even harder to find professional exposure to it, especially as a high schooler. Team Alpha provided that opportunity.

name: Gordon Glenn
experience: Experience doing typical video production client work. I do it all the time now.

name: Thomas Elwood
experience: My time with Team Alpha was one of the most positive and encouraging environments I've ever submerged myself in. It helped me break out of my shell, take risks, and become the person I am today.

name: Andrew Shields
experience: The weekly updates and listening to what everyone was doing helped me look at things differently with short term goals being key. It helped me realize that anything is possible if you break it into small, manageable chunks. It was also nice working with Nick on my senior design project, it always helps to make contacts.

name: Garrett Bonistalli
experience: Awesome Inc. is a lively environment that gave me exposure to many unique experiences that I otherwise wouldn't have had. The opportunities to attend certain business events and absorb real-world applicable information are memories that I still value and reference years later.

name: Alexie Basil
experience:
Team Alpha taught me that "awesomeness" is something very personal. What I think is awesome can be completely distinct from what someone else thinks is awesome, and that's okay -- not only is it okay, but that in and of itself is awesome.

I truly don't think I would have gotten into NYU, or had the courage to attend, without Team Alpha.

name: Roshnee Raithatha
experience: I learned a lot about how businesses operate, which for me as a young high-school student was a great experience. I worked with you professionals and gained a new perspective.

name: Owen Wirth
experience: It made me want to move to Wyoming and be a raft guide. I honestly have no idea.

name: Sarah Hoffmann
experience: I got to meet lots of motivated, interesting people that were making the things they believed in happen, and it continues to inspire me to do the same!

name: Will Oldham
experience: I got to experience the world of game design-- a world that I'd only thought about before, and realize that it was not only real, but very doable. That I could be doing it!

name: Julie Babbage
experience: My experience helped me to be better at thinking all the way through an issue or idea. It tapped into my pioneer-style of big-picture thinking, but also encouraged me to take it a step further and ask, "and then what?" Innovative thinking is great. Innovative thinking with a bonus of sustainability is awesome.

name: Amy Wolterman
experience: Team Alpha helped me reach my definition of awesome by allowing me to gain real world experience in graphic design while I was still in high school and early into my college career. It helped me to realize that graphic design is the field that I wanted to study and ultimately make a career.

name: Allister Littrell
experience: Two fold. The let us work on our own schedule. As long as we were making progress, we could work when and where we needed to. They also gave us the resources necessary to accomplish the tasks at hand. They were always willing to help out.

name: Evan Blanford
experience: Team alpha and the Awsome inc crew made me realize my goals and dreams and how possible it is to accomplish them. There is no reason not to chase your dreams and goals and that's awesome!

name: Kelsey Joseph
experience: Team Alpha made the saying that "no dream is too big" real for me. It is filled with outstanding individuals who put a face to that saying, and even though I was only at Awesome Inc for a short while, this is something that has stuck with me. I am working on a start up, and I am not sure that I would have thought it was possible to do this if I wouldn't have been inspired by those at Awesome Inc.

name: Taylor Church
experience: Team Alpha helped me to attain awesomeness by allowing me to exercise my leadership skills and collaborate with an awesome team!

name: Tommy Crush
experience: By encouraging me to continue spending time on things (aka coding) that others might not have seen the value in.

name: Krista Osmundson
experience:
Team Alpha trusted me not just to assist (in the typical intern fashion) but take the lead in hosting my first event, 5 Across. Awesome Inc's confidence in my abilities helped inspire it in myself.
I also love the 'do it yourself' attitude Awesome Inc promotes: Why work for someone else if you can do it better, smarter, and more efficient on your own?

name: Will Crawford
experience: I am in a blues rock band with my girlfriend.

name: Melanie Stockle
experience: Awesome Inc completely changed my life and I am forever grateful for this company and the people involved in it.  When I first came onto Team Alpha, I was a timid college sophomore who wanted to learn more design and had absolutely no clue about the startup world (or really what Awesome Inc even did).  Awesome Inc helped to give me the confidence and encouragement to work on my design skills and I learned so much there to help me get to where I am today - now immersed in the startup world of Boulder.  I wouldn't be here without them and all of their support.

name: Alek Zieba
experience: Team Alpha helped me reach my definition of awesome by showing me that it's possible to be productive and have fun at the same time, and this is especially true with the best projects.

name: Elizabeth Cooper
experience: They gave me the experience I needed to get internships at big name companies.

name: Michael Zhang
experience: Before I joined Team Alpha, I lost in life. After joining Team Alpha, I gained direction, and now I have decided to pursue a career in the software development industry.

name: Diante' Elcock
favoriteRule: Rule #21: The universal principle and indeed the purpose of life, business, sports, and all competition: Dominate.
randomFact: I made it across Percy-Lake with a floaty. Which is pretty awesome considering I can't swim.

name: Kevin Joiner
favoriteRule: Rule #76 "No excuses, play like a champion"

name: TJ Barnett
randomFact: I have an obsession with Dr. Pepper

name: Will Swinton-Ginsberg
favoriteRule: Rule #21: The universal principle and indeed the purpose of life, business, sports, and all competition: Dominate.
randomFact: I dove with Great White Sharks in South Africa

name: Sarah Brookbank
favoriteRule: Rule #26: don't let stupid things keep you from doing awesome things
randomFact: I want to be a New York Times Best Selling novelist.
